snippet.title: Brooks Running Shoes Hit Their Stride
snippet.description: Brooks Sports tried to go toe-to-toe with Nike across all sports, but couldn't keep pace. A renewed focus on performance running shoes helped the company take off. The subsidiary of Berkshire Hathaway is "on fire" says Warren Buffett. read »

snippet.title: Running The Numbers: What's The Real Cost Of Your Workout?
snippet.description: Meet the woman who does yoga three times a week—for six cents a workout. And the guy who pays $15,000 a year to stay in shape. read »

snippet.title: On Boylston Street: Lessons Learned At The Boston Marathon 'Makeshift' Memorial
snippet.description: Weeping Willow & Pond at Boston Common (Photo credit: Jill Clardy) I just spent 4 days in Boston, at a conference titled “Global Psychoanalysis in a Social World.” The timing, so soon after the Marathon and lockdown, was a total coincidence. Nevertheless, what happened was still on everyone’s mind. Many talks [...] read »

snippet.title: Excessive Celebration Penalties Are a Pox on Football, No Matter What Bob Costas Says
snippet.description: VideoThis is Billy "White Shoes" Johnson. If the 1970s-1980s-era NFL kick returner, the forefather of Devin Hester, was not the inventor of the end zone dance, he most certainly was the one who made it popular. Let's put it this way: my friends and I in North Muskegon, Mich., far from [...] read »

snippet.title: Designer Spotlight: 25Bedford Redefines The Power Suit
snippet.description: Leave it to a busy working mom to take a stand and lead the workwear revolution. Kudos. Keri McCarthy Ferry, founder of 25Bedford, is on a mission with her new online apparel brand to disrupt the corporate dress code in the best of ways by making getting dressed for work exciting [...] read »

snippet.title: What Social Media Managers Need To Know About Facebook In 2014
snippet.description: For many of us, it's hard to believe that 2013 is almost over. It was a big year for social media, as Twitter went public, Snapchat rejected a $3B offer from Facebook and the emergence of mobile as a primary device caused advertisers to scramble to reach their target audiences [...] read »

snippet.title: Newly-Minted Billionaire Is Spinning eBay Scraps Into Gold
snippet.description: Michael Rubin was running a real business at 14 and a public company at 23. Now 40, he has just become one of America?s youngest billionaires through entrepreneurial frenzy--and the ability to turn eBay scraps into the greatest deal you've never heard about. Watch out, Amazon. read »

snippet.title: Want To Make Those Day Care Bucks? Teach Soccer.
snippet.description: Gustavo Szulansky, an Argentinian-turned-New Yorker, has grown his Super Soccer Stars chain into 200 locations since 2000, with more to come. read »
